remarks.para: Do not forget to reset m_IsOver value of each state if you do not want your state to leave as soon as it enters.
Also, you should call the FSMState mother class functions when overriding (Enter, Exit, etc.).

T:XKTools.Asset.BundleManager.AssetBundleEvent
member.summary: In case of Success / Failure of bundle management, such a event will be triggered. The first argument contains the reference object helping retrieving the BundleInfo object. The third argument contains where the result comes from (EProcessOrder) In case of success, the second argument contains the BundleInfo object. In case of failure, the second argument contains the error message.

member.name: M:XKTools.Context.Message.MessageBase.ToObjectList
member.summary: Format: [[recreation Ids], [routing], [message data]] where [message data] = [[int buffer], [float buffer], other data]] when MessageBuilder.BinaryFormat is NonTyped About int and float buffers, note that: - float buffer handles float, double, Vector2 and Vector3 types - they are automatically handled by the PreMessagePush, PostMessagePush, PreMessagePop and PostMessagePop methods - they are optional, which that if they are empty, [message data] could be [[float buffer], [other data]] or [[other data]] for instance - they can only store values that are at the same level as the ArrayList from PushMessage. Any value on a lower level (an Hashtable in this ArrayList for instance) will not be stored in any buffer

path = ".../Assets/Graphics/Textures/Atlas/Game/" => Creates the directory Game/ at .../Assets/Graphics/Textures/Atlas path = ".../Assets/Graphics/Textures/Atlas/Game/Game.png" => Creates the directory Game/ at .../Assets/Graphics/Textures/Atlas

member.name: T:XKTools.Data.MiniJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes ArrayList and Hashtable. All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: F:XKTools.Data.MiniJson.s_LastErrorIndex
member.summary: On decoding, this value holds the position at which the parse failed (-1 = no error).

member.name: M:XKTools.Data.MiniJson.JsonDecode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.param: if true, numbers are parsed as double else as float. default is false
member.returns: An ArrayList, a Hashtable, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.summary: Converts a Hashtable / ArrayList / Dictionary(string,string) object into a JSON string
member.param: number of authorized numbers after the decimal point, -1 means no limitation
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.summary: On decoding, this function returns the position at which the parse failed (-1 = no error).

member.summary: On decoding, this function returns the position at which the parse failed (-1 = no error).

member.name: T:XKTools.Data.TypedBinarySerializer
member.summary:
Serialize / Unserialize some objects in binary format. For each ToBinary() extension and ParseBinaryX() method, you can add a boolean argument 'typed' (true by default). If true, then a byte the the type is added/parsed for each value taht is not in a container. Else, this byte will be skipped.
For byte, float and int arrays, the type is only added once (not for every object instance). For int values, if 'typed' is false, then the method called are SerializeB/UnSerializeB() (BinarySerializer). Strings are encoded in/decoded from ASCII.

member.name: M:XKTools.Matht.SolveQuadraticPolynomialRoots(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Compute the real roots of a quadratic polynomial whose formula is 'a'*x*x + 'b'*x + 'c'. If delta is strictly negative, both 'x1' and 'x2' are NaN. If delta = 0, 'x1' and 'x2' both have the value of the unique root. Else, delta is strictly negative and it is ensured that 'x1' is smaller than 'x2'.
member.param: The first root. Always valid except when returned value is EQuadraticPolynomialResult.InvalidPolynomial.
The second root. Always valid except when returned value is EQuadraticPolynomialResult.InvalidPolynomial.
member.returns: Either: - EQuadraticPolynomialResult.InfiniteNumberOfRoots when equation is 0 = 0, - EQuadraticPolynomialResult.InvalidPolynomial when equation is c = 0 with c != 0, - EQuadraticPolynomialResult.NoRoot when delta is strictly negative, - EQuadraticPolynomialResult.OneRoot when 'a' or delta is nul, or - EQuadraticPolynomialResult.TwoRoots when delta is strictly positive.

member.name: T:XKTools.NotifierManager
member.summary:
This manager helps to send events to registers systems.
Sometimes, you might want to limit the send events to specifics events. In those cases, you'll have to add some restrictions on the events you wants to authorize. As soon as a restriction is added, then all other events that are not in list won't be send.

member.name: M:XKTools.PhysicManager.CheckOnRigibodies
member.summary: Function that check rigidbodies that have been added to the check list If one of them gets physical (or fucking physical cf Jack Black) the manager calls on its "PhysicActivatedHandler" delegate if it was in the some bodies are non kinematic and they suddenly become kinematic, then it calls on its "PhysicDeactivatedHandler" delegate. "m_AllKinematic" indicates the "state" of the physic manager : if true, then there is no rigidbody currently active, else at least one of them is active I.E. Used in Kill The Bad Guy in order to force the timescale to 1.0f and lock it to avoid screwed physic behaviour

member.param: If non null, this will override the ERPCMode

summary.para: This explicits wheter or not the package will be immediately send.
Default is WaitForSyncTime

member.name: P:XKTools.Net.NetData.SyncTime

summary.para: This explicits the remaining time to wait wbefore sending data through network.
Default is 0.1 second

member.remarks: A null or negative value will be considered as Immediate sending

summary.para: ERPCMode.All -> Sends to everyone (me included)
ERPCMode.AllBuffered -> Sends to everyone (me included) and adds to the buffer
ERPCMode.Others -> Sends to everyone but me, server included
ERPCMode.OthersBuffered -> Sends to everyone but me, server included and adds to the buffer (all but me?, server included)
ERPCMode.Server -> Sends to the server only
This helps to send messages to someone in particular.
This overrides the chosen ERPCMode

member.name: T:XKTools.Net.NetworkControllerUnity
member.summary: This object helps sending data over the network.

summary.para: This class contains the network controller responsible for sending and receiving data.
This class also manages the GUI interface that helps connecting to the world (even the local world).
Usage:
First, you have to register a function that is able to create your INetworkable "Avatar" in game.
-> Use NetworkController.CreatePlayer = SphereAvatar.CreateTestObject; // (for instance)
Then, you can set the function to create your own GUI (default GUI display nothing).
-> You can use NetworkManager.CreateGUI = ServerDiscoveryGUI.CreateGUI;
Then, you'll need to create a server and connect clients (the NetworkConnectorGUI makes the trick).
Finally, you can send data that way:
NetData data = new NetData("MyReference");
data.PushData(m_WhateverDataAsLongAsItsSerializable);
data.SendType = ESendType.WaitForSyncTime;
data.RPCMode = ERPCMode.Others;
s_NetworkManager.NetworkController.SendNetData(data);

member.name: M:XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.PredictVelocityNeeded(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.ConditionCheck,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Try to predict the velocity needed for the object to get to the target position. You must specifies an error tolerance and the maximum number of tries, but also the axis that are importants. Ex : if you target a point which is at the same height than your object, you need xAxis and zAxis only
member.param: Position of the object which will be launched.
Direction in which you want to launch your object. Direction must be unitized!
The position you want to reach.

A function that should return true when the object must stop depending of the velocity, position and time. For example : YUnderZero() return true when the object Y is under 0 (most of the time when the object goes underground)

The maximum number of tries after which the prediction will stop whatever the result is. 25 is a good number. The more the tolerance is low, the more tries you must have, but try not to chose over 500 tries.
The error tolerance : the maximum distance between your targeted position and the position you will obtain with the veloc predicted
member.returns: A Vector3 representing the velocity which is needed to reach the targeted point.

member.name: M:XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.PredictVelocityNeeded(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.ConditionCheck,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single@)

member.param: Position of the object which will be launched.

The maximum number of tries after which the prediction will stop whatever the result is. 25 is a good number. The more the tolerance is low, the more tries you must have, but try not to chose over 500 tries.
The error tolerance : the maximum distance between your targeted position and the position you will obtain with the veloc predicted
member.returns: A Vector3 representing the velocity which is needed to reach the targeted point.

member.summary: Try to predict the veloc needed for the object to get to the target position. You must specifies an error tolerance and the maximum number of tries, but also the axis that are importants. Ex : if you target a point which is at the same height than your object, you need xAxis and zAxis only
member.param: Position of the object which will be launched.
Direction in which you want to launch your object. Direction must be unitized!
The position you want to reach.

A function that should return true when the object must stop depending of the velocity, position and time. For example : YUnderZero() return true when the object Y is under 0 (most of the time when the object goes underground)

The maximum number of tries after which the prediction will stop whatever the result is. 25 is a good number. The more the tolerance is low, the more tries you must have, but try not to chose over 500 tries.
The error tolerance : the maximum distance between your targeted position and the position you will obtain with the veloc predicted
An array of vector3 which will contain every position of the trajectory
member.returns: A Vector3 representing the veloc and direction which is needed to reach the targeted point.

member.name: M:XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.PredictVelocityAndSlopeNeeded(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.ConditionCheck,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Try to predict the veloc needed for the object to get to the target position. If the direction indicated does not allow to reach the target point, the slope is adjusted to reach the target You must specifies an error tolerance and the maximum number of tries.
member.param: Position of the object which will be launched.
Direction in which you want to launch your object. Direction must be unitized!
The position you want to reach.

A function that should return true when the object must stop depending of the velocity, position and time. For example : YUnderZero() return true when the object Y is under 0 (most of the time when the object goes underground)

The maximum number of tries after which the prediction will stop whatever the result is. 25 is a good number. The more the tolerance is low, the more tries you must have, but try not to chose over 500 tries.
The error tolerance : the maximum distance between your targeted position and the position you will obtain with the veloc predicted
member.returns: A Vector3 representing the veloc and direction which is needed to reach the targeted point.

member.name: M:XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.ComputeFrictionAndReflectionCoef(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Compute the friction and reflection coef of two material from a collision that happened. This function is meant to be used while programming, to compute coef that you will then use in your computation to predict bounciness. Example : you have a ball that you launch on the floor and you want to predict bounces, but you don't have the friction nor the reflection coef. Project your ball on the floor, keep in memory your in and out velocity. Use this function to get the coef, write them down somewhere, then remove this function, and use them to predict bounces.
member.param: The velocity that the object had when making contact.
The velocity that the object had after contact (the "bounce" velocity).
The normal of the surface hit by the object. Please remember that a normal should be normalized.

member.name: M:XKTools.Physics.PhysicPrediction.PredictBounceVelocity(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Compute the "bounce" velocity of an object. This function takes the velocity that an object will have when touching an obstacle, the normal of this obstacle and the friction and reflection coef (which depends on how you've set your set and materials) and compute the "bounce" velocity which is the velocity the object will have after collision. This function is more or less precise depending of the precision of the given coef.
member.param: The velocity that the object will have when making contact.
The normal of the surface hit by the object. Please remember that a normal should be normalized.

member.name: M:XKTools.Sound.SoundManager.GetClipNoLog(System.Object)
member.summary: Directly return the clip if it was in memory If it wasn't then load the clip and return it. If the clip is not found, does not log errors. Can be used to determine if a clip exist or not. For instance : on Metegol, we used it calling [TeamName]_[Sound] and if it did not exist we used it calling Common_[Sound] => If the specific sound did not exist, we used the common sound.

member.name: T:XKTools.Uninput
member.summary:
Class for Uninput
Remember to change version number when you make a big modification to this class.
Connector :
Make sure your project use Uninput and Network Manager.
You can either launch connector from XKTools' Main (boolean "show connector"), or with a simple line of code "NetworkManager.Instance.ShowConnector()".
You may also precise a default feedback quality by setting Uninput.NetworkQuality value.

member.name: T:System.Half
member.summary: [Code from http://sourceforge.net/projects/csharp-half/ Caution: implementation is not conform to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half-precision_floating-point_format#Precision_limitations_on_decimal_values_in_.5B0.2C_1.5D converning the integer precision limitations: values are rounded to a multiple of 32 until 65535 instead of 65519] Represents a half-precision floating point number.
member.remarks:
Note: Half is not fast enought and precision is also very bad, so is should not be used for matemathical computation (use Single instead). The main advantage of Half type is lower memory cost: two bytes per number. Half is typically used in graphical applications.
Note: All functions, where is used conversion half->float/float->half, are approx. ten times slower than float->double/double->float, i.e. ~3ns on 2GHz CPU.
References: - Fast Half Float Conversions, Jeroen van der Zijp, link: http://www.fox-toolkit.org/ftp/fasthalffloatconversion.pdf - IEEE 754 revision, link: http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/754/

member.name: F:System.Half.value
member.summary: Internal representation of the half-precision floating-point number.

member.summary: Represents the smallest positive System.Half value greater than zero. This field is constant.

member.summary: Represents the smallest possible value of System.Half. This field is constant.

member.summary: Represents not a number (NaN). This field is constant.

member.summary: Represents negative infinity. This field is constant.

member.summary: Represents positive infinity. This field is constant.

member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. Return Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than value. Zero This instance is equal to value. Greater than zero This instance is greater than value.

member.name: M:System.Half.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified System.Object.
member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. Return Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than value. Zero This instance is equal to value. Greater than zero This instance is greater than value. -or- value is null.
member.exception: value is not a System.Half

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance and a specified System.Half object represent the same value.
member.param: A System.Half object to compare to this instance.
member.returns: true if value is equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance and a specified System.Object represent the same type and value.
member.returns: true if value is a System.Half and equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns the specified half-precision floating point value as an array of bytes.
member.returns: An array of bytes with length 2.

member.name: M:System.Half.GetBits(System.Half)
member.summary: Converts the value of a specified instance of System.Half to its equivalent binary representation.
member.returns: A 16-bit unsigned integer that contain the binary representation of value.

member.name: M:System.Half.ToHalf(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a half-precision floating point number converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A half-precision floating point number formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.
member.exception: startIndex is greater than or equal to the length of value minus 1, and is less than or equal to the length of value minus 1.
value is null.
startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 1.

member.name: M:System.Half.ToHalf(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns a half-precision floating point number converted from its binary representation.
member.returns: A half-precision floating point number formed by its binary representation.

member.name: M:System.Half.Sign(System.Half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating the sign of a half-precision floating-point number.
member.returns: A number indicating the sign of value. Number Description -1 value is less than zero. 0 value is equal to zero. 1 value is greater than zero.
member.exception: value is equal to System.Half.NaN.

member.name: M:System.Half.Abs(System.Half)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a half-precision floating-point number.
member.param: A number in the range System.Half.MinValue value System.Half.MaxValue.
member.returns: A half-precision floating-point number, x, such that 0 x System.Half.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.Half.Max(System.Half,System.Half)
member.summary: Returns the larger of two half-precision floating-point numbers.
member.param: The first of two half-precision floating-point numbers to compare.
The second of two half-precision floating-point numbers to compare.
member.returns: Parameter value1 or value2, whichever is larger. If value1, or value2, or both val1 and value2 are equal to System.Half.NaN, System.Half.NaN is returned.

member.name: M:System.Half.Min(System.Half,System.Half)
member.summary: Returns the smaller of two half-precision floating-point numbers.
member.param: The first of two half-precision floating-point numbers to compare.
The second of two half-precision floating-point numbers to compare.
member.returns: Parameter value1 or value2, whichever is smaller. If value1, or value2, or both val1 and value2 are equal to System.Half.NaN, System.Half.NaN is returned.

member.name: M:System.Half.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.
member.returns: The System.Half number equivalent to the number contained in value.
member.exception: value is null.
value is not in the correct format.
value represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.Half.Parse(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent using the specified culture-specific format information.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.
An System.IFormatProvider that supplies culture-specific parsing information about value.
member.returns: The System.Half number equivalent to the number contained in s as specified by provider.
member.exception: value is null.
value is not in the correct format.
value represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.Half.Parse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number in a specified style to its System.Half equivalent.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.

A bitwise combination of System.Globalization.NumberStyles values that indicates the style elements that can be present in value. A typical value to specify is System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Number.
member.returns: The System.Half number equivalent to the number contained in s as specified by style.
member.exception: value is null.
style is not a System.Globalization.NumberStyles value. -or- style is the System.Globalization.NumberStyles.AllowHexSpecifier value.
value is not in the correct format.
value represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.Half.Parse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent using the specified style and culture-specific format.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.

A bitwise combination of System.Globalization.NumberStyles values that indicates the style elements that can be present in value. A typical value to specify is System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Number.
An System.IFormatProvider object that supplies culture-specific information about the format of value.
member.returns: The System.Half number equivalent to the number contained in s as specified by style and provider.
member.exception: value is null.
style is not a System.Globalization.NumberStyles value. -or- style is the System.Globalization.NumberStyles.AllowHexSpecifier value.
value is not in the correct format.
value represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.Half.TryParse(System.String,System.Half@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the System.Half number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in value, if the conversion succeeded, or is zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not a number in a valid format, or represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Half.TryParse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.IFormatProvider,System.Half@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent using the specified style and culture-specific format. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.
A bitwise combination of System.Globalization.NumberStyles values that indicates the permitted format of value. A typical value to specify is System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Number.
An System.IFormatProvider object that supplies culture-specific parsing information about value.

When this method returns, contains the System.Half number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in value, if the conversion succeeded, or is zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not in a format compliant with style, or represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.exception: style is not a System.Globalization.NumberStyles value. -or- style is the System.Globalization.NumberStyles.AllowHexSpecifier value.

member.name: T:System.HalfHelper
member.summary: [Code from http://sourceforge.net/projects/csharp-half/ The only modifications done here are in HalfToSingle and SingleToHalf in order to remove the 'unsafe' property] Helper class for Half conversions and some low level operations. This class is internally used in the Half class.
member.remarks: References: - Fast Half Float Conversions, Jeroen van der Zijp, link: http://www.fox-toolkit.org/ftp/fasthalffloatconversion.pdf
